Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @PHBA2061 if you are asking "how many transactions does it take to fill a block?", it's quite dependent on which coin you are talking about

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: or are you asking "how many xtns could possibly fit in a block?"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it only takes very few very fat transactions to fill a block

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`"how many xtns could possibly fit in a block?"`
all of them :troll:

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: on ZEC, you can fill a block with 1 transaction

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: somebody thought that was a good idea

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: on ARRR it's about 20, iirc

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: you can get 16x in there if you pretend that the signatures are somewhere else and their data is trasnported by magic

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: KMD does not have sapling and the numbers are different

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: DoS'ing via fat xtns is the most financially efficient way to DoS the network, but the dwy attack is "worse" in various ways, and costs a bit more

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: doing both at the same time would be rough times

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: it costs less if you have chickens on your farm

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: dwy attack is expensive enough that you couldn't do it indefintely

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Sapling Woodchipper is so cheap, you could fund it forever with a single Z9, most likely

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's quite bad

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the dwy woodchipper

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content:
@dukeleto  `or are you asking "how many xtns could possibly fit in a block?"`
what I meant is how many utxo could possibly fit in a block, I know that transactions size can vary, but I'm not sure about utxo size, sorry did not clearly express myself üòÇ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is the same question

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 4MB blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 2KB per zkproof

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 74 bytes per signature

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: p2pk is the most efficient one when it comes to spending

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so a large sendmany with lots of p2pk outputs as the vin source will allow many tx, especially if they are just using a txfee to send a 1 byte opreturn

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then each tx would be less than 100 bytes and you could get 40,000 in one block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or you can make 200kb tx and get 20 in a block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so your questions is not phrased correctly
